rComments: He refused to give me any accommodations even though I'm handicapped.
the lectures were really interactive which made them nice
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Participation matters', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: Do not take a class with this professor. Long lectures where he reads the entire Power point, except for the moments where he tells personnal anecdotes. DO TAKE NOTES on them because some exam questions are about these anecdotes. Unrelevant questions in exams like dates which do not represent the understanding of the material. Not recorded classes.

Son cours est intéressant, il raconte beaucoup d'anecdotes en lien avec la vie réelle. Seul hic: ses anecdotes n'ont rien à voir avec la matière évaluée. Ses examens sont basés sur les planches powerpoint qu'il survole en classe et sur des détails - que je juge insignifiants - en lien avec les lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: Bonne chance si tu manque un cours ou si tu ne lis pas ou ne regarde pas les vidéos qu'il demande de lire ou regarder. Si tu fait ce qu'il te demande, le cours est vraiment facile. Je conseille de se fier à ses notes de cours, ses vidéos, le roman obligatoire et les lectures pour étudier. Il dit a l'avance sur quoi l'examen sera centré.

Very interesting and captivating professor. I really liked participating to his lectures which you should DEFINITELY participate since there will be 'surprise' quizzes in his class. In general, he was fine except when purposely downgrading students to maintain an average that suits his expectations.

Dont take this class with this prof. His exams are way too specific to the lectures & have nothing to do with criminology. During the class, he rushes all the important information at the end. Theres also surprise quizzes that have 5 questions and you only get 5 min.

M. Doiron is definitely one of my favorite profs! He makes his classes fun and engaging while teaching you useful information. His lectures keep you interested and go by very fast. M. Doiron knows what he talks about in class and always comes prepared. If you put in the effort in his classes, he will make sure that you succeed!

Je ne comprends pas pourquoi ce professeur a une mauvaise note sur Rate my professors. Je l'ai eu seulement pour ce cours, mais je n'hésiterai certainement pas à le reprendre dans un autre cours. C'est un des meilleurs professeurs que j'ai eu depuis le début de mes études.

I've had this prof for multiple classes. I honestly think he is one of the better profs I've ever had. At first, I believed him to be too severe, but after my second class with him I saw that he is really good and he only wants for students to succeed. He makes you work for it that's true, but the result at the end makes it all the better.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: He is a good prof, tries to make his lectures entertaining and clearly enjoys the subject of criminology. You will need to read a lot, and some of the exam questions will be pretty specific. In my experience, he has always mentioned the "surprise" quizzes in advance. Take good notes in class and on readings and you'll be fine.

Nice guy but his class is ridiculous. Makes you read a book + articles then ask the most stupid and irrelevant questions. His exams are so hard and you need to remember stuff he didn't even talk about "we saw this during class" no tf we didn't. Talks alot about his life then rushes through the slides at the end of class (class is not even recorded)
horrible and the questions are not about crimino, it's about small details that nobody remembered.
He's so specific when it comes to the question on the exam. Also, he talks about useless stuff for most of the class and then rushes the important slides at the end.

He convey's the subject in an interesting way for students to engage however, he will not change your grade even if you are able justify them. Also the exams are very specific to the readings... will not be taking his class again.

Professor Doiron is a great professor. He always gives students the opportunity to ask questions regarding the course content if they need and he makes his lectures entertaining. I honestly don't understand all the bad reviews on here because he is definitely one of the better profs at uOttawa. Would 100% recommend him as a prof.
Really cool and easy if you study a minimum and read the texts. The bad comments are a little group or the same person and they always challenged the prof. Really annoying for the other students!
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Un des pires enseignants de cette faculté. Vous allez avoir besoin de vous rappeler dune plaque dimmatriculation comme matière dexamen.

Horrible just horrible. He asked us a question that was from the FOOTNOTE of a long and hard reading. Like dozens and dozens of pages. You will need to read SEVERAL HUNDRED PAGES and he could ask you specific words, dates, times, names from these readings. His exams are EXTREMELY unfair.

Did not record any classes so presence is required, 6 pop quizzes that you have 5 minutes to do, tried to force respondus on us, irrelevant details are put on exams and if I had a dollar for every time he mentions Canada Post I would be able to pay for my degree. The only perk was the bond that the students had for not wanting to attend class
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: expects you to know minuscule details from 24-page readings and tests you on them. Reads of the slides during class and doesn't elaborate further. Unwilling to change teaching/grading methods even after receiving feedback from students that they are being set up to fail.

I agree with the last few comments below. I do not understand why this guy is even allowed to teach. The amount that you need to read is extremely excessive. The questions he asks on exams are not relevant to the class. He makes us memorize EVERYTHING from his long, exhausting readings. Like little tiny irrelevant details.

I am surprised this prof is still allowed to teach at uOttawa. He assigns hundreds of pages to study (and know by heart) for each exam, and asks absolutely academically irrelevent questions about them. Most of his exams are about the readings, and what is about the course will not be on his slides. Trap questions and no care for his class. RUN!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Tough grader']

rComments: IF YOU HAVE THE CHANCE TO TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR RATHER THAN HIM DO IT. I had him last year in 1700 and he wasn't too bad but this year he gives no chance at all and is way to specific. Il n'est pas flexible quand ça vient au cour en ligne et il n'enregistre pas les cours. Les examens sont trop specifiques and it has nothing to do with crim.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF! His exams questions focus on details that are wayyyyyy to specific to the point that, in my opinion, many of his exam questions do not even reflect the overall understanding of the student. It is super hard to get a good grade in this class. I am a good student and I usually find school easy but not this class!

I had this prof for CRM1701 and CRM2700 and both terrible experiences. Get ready to memorize very specific details of readings, videos, lectures, you name it. For example, on the final he made a multiple choice asking the specific day a girl died in a video we had watched 4 weeks before the exam... and he uses Respondus for online, just a warning..
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Il donne environ 60 pages à lire par semaine et les lectures font parti des examens. Il parle pour ne rien dire. Il s'attarde au mini détail. Il redit les mêmes anecdotes que dans 1700.. Il parle des consignes sans cesse. Il parle PENDANT les examens/quizz. Il dit que les questions d'examen ne sont pas des ''pognes'' mais c'est faux attention!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: For the first 45mins of the 3hr lecture, he talks about the most pointless and random things, repeats useless info over and over. He literally takes so much time to actually start teaching the class, so if you show up half an hour late, you won't miss a thing. This class has so much potential to be interesting but he literally ruined it all.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Ce professeur est horrible. Il parle uniquement de lui-même au début de chaque cours, ses powerpoint sont remplis de long textes qu'il lit du tableau. Un professeur qui se pense très bon, il est arrogant. Éviter ce professeur!!!!!!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: Engaging lectures. HOWEVER, his exams, pop quizzes and finals are all on statistics that have no weight or value to the class. Legit one of his questions was: how many people were released from THIS prison on THIS day, for THIS crime. The answer to these questions is embedded in one of the very many readings he assigns.

Prof imbu de lui même. Tu dois TOUT connaître pour les examens... Le genre d'étude ou tu n'apprend rien et que tu fais juste te bourrer le crâne de statistique datant de 2011-2012... L'examen n'est pas sur la connaissance de la matière mais sur le fait de savoir par coeur des dates.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Test heavy']

rComments: This prof talks about content not related to the class for most of the lecture and then quickly rushes through important Powerpoint slides at the end. He reads off of the Powerpoint without explaining what he is saying. The assigned readings are very long and heavy. Lots of dates and stats in exams. Not polite and pompous. Avoid if possible.
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Not the best teacher. He tends to read from his PowerPoints without explaining. He assigns lots of readings to do outside of class. He also has pop quizzes, so dont miss class. I found that some of the questions on exams were very specific (like stats from certain years). Seems to care about students, but the class requires lots of effort.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: Pire prof de criminologie.

He's off topic. Talks about everything and nothing. When he teaches, he reads his powerpoint for 3hours straight. everything he says is on the test. There is no revision. He is not very accessible outside of the class. Boring. Very. Boring.

He is an amazing prof! If you are devoted to your work and do the readings you will love his class. He does have pop quizzes but they can really help your average ! I would definitely recommend his class:)

Quel personnage ce Doiron!! Il parle souvent pour répéter les consignes et s'étire un peu trop sur des détails comme le plagiat. L'examen est difficile la première fois car il s'attaque à des minis détails insignifiants que jamais tu ne penseraient voir dans un examen, connais toutes les dates et détails par cœur et tu vas avoir une très bonne note

Les cours sont très intéressants mais les examens ne sont pas faciles. Il faut savoir les dates et les statistiques par cœur pour les examens et surtout les quiz ! Le travail de mi- session n'est pas clair, il faut aller le voir pour des spécifications. Les questions à choix multiples sont des questions piège, faites sûr de bien les lires !
I actually thought he was a great prof. One of the most engaging. VERY helpful. If you want to do well, he gives you every opportunity. Great prof. I have taken multiple courses with him.

Je l'ai trouvé très intimidant et arrogant, je n'osais pas trop aller le voir. S'il ne donnait pas de pop quizzes (qui augmentent la note finale!), je ne serais pas allée en classe (tout est sur BBL). Le travail de session est long, mais il est facile d'avoir une bonne note. Donne des indices sur la matière qui va être à l'examen.

Prof Doiron was one of my least favourite profs at uOttawa. He loves to tell personal anecdotes in class that barely relate to class material. His slides, which he posts online, are extremely long and heavy. Midterm is easy, but the final has most of the class material on it, so memorize lists! Gives pop quizzes in some classes so you need to go.

He means well, but literally the most teacher ever. He post long slides every week and will quiz you on the most useless material. He struggles to finish 10 slides in 3 hours and overall talks to much about himself and his experiences.. which are pointless. Overall not a good teacher and expects you to know to much stuff. Do not do it!

I took this class in my fourth year because I forgot to take it in second year, and I've honestly never been so frustrated in a course before. He never once was able to finish a lesson because he just rambles on about stuff that has nothing to do with the class. He is 100% conservative and has no problem letting everyone know.
AWESOME PROFESSOR

Michel is one of the best professors of Criminology at the University of Ottawa. He is very knowledgable, funny and passionate about what he teaches. If you want to succeed in his class, just do the readings, take good notes and ask questions.  The prof  is just simple amazing!

Very straightforward, funny and interesting. Everyone seemed to like the text for this class; however, I didn't like it at all. Took this course in summer and was pretty intense, but from the notes and his explanations I managed to do pretty well even if the text was not my favourite. I would take him again. Quizzes in class are a mark booster.

Prof très imbu de lui-même : se prend pour le meilleur gars de la Terre. Répète le syllabus pendant 40min à chaque cours (3h). Passe pas toute la matière, alors tu dois le faire chez toi en plus des lectures vrm longues. Qst d'examen pas toujours fair et pas en lien avec la matière (2pts chaque, choix multiple). À éviter si possible

Not a bad prof, show up and take east quizs for 20%. Hard ass on the paper, but I should have followed instructions better to Not cumulative. He is a little self absorbed, rambles about himself, tells same story 2-3 times throughout course. Intresting guest speaker Participate and go see him in office hrs for best results. Go to class or fail

He's a good prof. He is funny and mostly interesting even though he sometimes gets lost in rain of thought. His exams are tough if you are not good at memorizing stats and dates but once you know what to expect his exams get easier. There are quizzes at random times and are usually on really specific stuff but usually boosts up the class average.

Great lecturer, very interesting material and very enthusiastic about what he's teaching. However, he's not very approachable or polite. I asked him for help with some questions I noticed while studying and he made me feel terrible about myself before walking into his midterm. Easy class, but he tests you on statistics and things you wouldnt expect
Doiron is certainly a character. He is funny at times with rude undertones, but will keep you entertained. If you want to succeed in his class, go visit him during office hours and ask him questions.

Bon sens de l'humour, rend ses cours intéressants. Par contre, les quiz sont sur des détails anodins, et forcent la présence en classe, qui autrement, ne serait pas nécessaire puisqu'il envoie tous ses PP. Il est parfois arrogant. Ses examens sont difficiles, portent sur des faits (dates etc.) complètement inutiles à connaitre. À éviter si possible

Very rude and arrogant. He always goes off-subject to discuss of his current and past professions. Exams had a lot of content that was only elaborated in the readings which were extremely boring. I would not recommend this teacher.
GOOD teacher !! Very interesting !! !! easy Quiz hihi

Cet enseignant adore parler de lui même et se vanter.  Au début tu es très content de l'avoir pensant que tu va avoir du fun avec mais non au contraire, il se fou pas mal des élèves.  Ces examens sont assez facile, mais son projet est corrigé par ses assistants qui ont toute leur propre manière à corriger.  Très baveux aussi et arrogant. À évité

Very good prof. Clear expectations, clear lectures, very willing to help a student succeed if they show interest. He ties theory into practice well, and does not have very difficult exams. Random quizzes are easy marks that get people to attend class. I would take classes with him again in a heartbeat.

Nice prof and seems very eager to help out students. Spends at LEAST 20mins at the beginning of the class to complain abt low attendance. And then he reads the powerpoint and doesn't add on. I would've skipped class if it weren't for the quizzes with are basically free points!

Completely useless lectures,I took this class with the expectation of learning the history of criminology but instead informed on every aspect of running a post office. Often went into to current criminology completely ignoring the slides, than quickly reading through the slides t the end of class because he ran out of time.

Love this guy. Had a few different classes with him. He is very clear about his expectations. For those that said he put stuff on his exams he didn't teach, they obviously didn't go to class. If you pay attention, go to class, there is no reason why you can't get a great grade. As you get in to upper years he gets more challenging.

I've had this prof for a couple of classes. He is a GREAT prof. He is very knowledgeable - if you are willing to put the effort in he is willing to do whatever it takes to help you succeed - seriously great prof! I would take additional courses in a second if there were additional courses offered.

Absolutely terrible professor. Got a good grade, but he always skip classes, give out exam questions that are irrelevant and very narcissistic in person. He is very uncritical about the justice system. Just memorize everything in his class and you are fine.

Love Doiron! Took all of his classes. Hated him for community intervention but really got to see how helpful he is in Individial Intervention. Amazing with smaller class sizes, very helpful and clear with expectations. Wish he taught more courses for OttawaU crim!

worst professor ever. Never take this class, puts things on the final he doesn't even teach. Puts irrelevant things on the exam. Very unhelpful and is narcissistic. I got a good grade in the class and I still think he is a terrible prof.

Overall acceptable class. Pretty much uses the power points that came with the textbook so all of the info that you need is in the textbook. He makes attendance mandatory though by giving random easy quizes throughout the semester. You can tell he's a criminologist though because he is obsessed with barking out orders. Overall he is a good lecturer

I've taken 3 classes with him because he is clear in his expectations and lectures are somewhat interesting with practical examples. He believes in what he teaches and has very much experience that can be tapped... Likes upper-year students/keeners!

Anyone who complains about the quizzes being redundant doesn't get the point, the quiz is just to make sure you go to class. It easy marks for showing up. It is all about the text, swears a lot but unless you are overly sensitive you shouldn't be offended. If you can't handle his bad words you are in the wrong field, criminals use bad words too.

my favourite prof! I keep taking his classes cause I love his teaching style & how he can actually keep my attention in a 3 hour lecture. shows lots of videos to change things up & his super easy pop-quizzes are just free points as long as you've been listening. plus its nice leaving a lecture knowing that you just made 5% on simple 1-word answers.

Notoriously foul mouth - Needs to realize he is offending a lot of people by what he says. Pretty boring although thinks he is witty which isn't true. Marks are easy to get, although quizzes are redundant as they test you on useless facts. Really makes a three hour lecture drag on.

Good Professor. Easy to get good marks in the class if you read the textbook, and highlight important information. His pop quizzes are an easy way to get a solid 18-20% of your grade, just remember important info mentioned in class. Funny guy, and definitely made 3 hour lectures fly by :).

Holy crap.  It is extremely difficult to get great marks in this course.  He thinks that a 75 is a great mark.  Multiple choice questions can be very tricky and are worth 2% each.  EVERYTHING is from the text - know it inside and out.  Nice guy, but he seems too aggressive for my liking.

Very fun/interesting prof. LOts of class discussion, makes the 3 hours go by fast. HIs pop quizzes can be annoying because their very specific... so remember dates and little details from hiz movies and lectures...he relies 99% on the text book..so know it inside out...pretty hard marker...overall fun class..just come to class and do readings

He's a good prof.  He keeps class interesting and as long as you study the content taught and do the readings, it's not impossible to get a good mark. Im enjoying his class this semester.  He makes a 3 hour lecture not too painful to get through.
FUNNIEST MAN ALIVE

Funny guy,but not a very good professor,gives ridiculous random quizzes where you often need to know the most trivial of details,would not recommend this guy,you can come to class,do the readings and it guarantees you nothing with him,his exams are quite hard as well

Well isnt that obvious that Doiron just typed that below! He's not nice - he's rarely prepared - he gives out quizzes to make sure that people come to his class - (which they never do) - if you have a friday class with him or a class at a bad time thats when hell give them out - hes balding pretty bad - and hes got fake armani glasses

Doiron, is an amazing prof. He interests me in many other ways professors need to learn about how to do. However, his classes are not very easy and you should not go in ever thinking it will be a breeze. He is hard, and asks questions that sometimes he should aka DATES!

Doiron is a great person, but his teaching skills are not very helpful. His tests are hard (even though he claims they are easy) and he gives his classes quizzes as if we're six years old again. Interesting man, funny prof, but DO NOT take any class with him if you want a good mark...
Excellent prof! Always available for extra help when needed. Very clear expectations, and good teaching style. Kept class interesting.
Not too bad of a teacher. He manages to make a boring subject interesting. His exams are pretty hard so make sure you do all the readings required!
Are expected to know small, seemingly unimportant, details for the exam. Good story teller. Second half of class material is 100x better than first.

Well I think everyone is entitled to their own opinion...there is no need for name calling...and I would have to agree with the positive comments...Prof Doiron is a good prof and his classes are very interesting! If you attend class, read the readings, and work hard...you should end up with a good grade.

I thought that he was a very fair professor... In order to do well in this class you definitely have to attend all the lectures and do all of the readings as his exams are very specific. He is an easy marker, and he also makes class very interesting. He shares a lot of personal stories in order to make the concepts easier to understand.
Good lectures, makes classes fun
doesn't teach... more like bigotted talk about personal encounters

Doiron is no where as bad as others make him out to be. If you listen in class, do your readings - you'll finish with a good mark. 20% for showing up, and the essay was marked extremely easy, I finished with an A+. I suspect the negative comments come from the kids in class who didn't know how to shut up and thought they knew everything.

That person has NO CLUE what they are talking about..he's awful!! I agree 100% with the other 2 comments..he is an ass & really stuck up..I hope that no one else has to be put through his****ty class..especially since his exam was really hard & since he lied about the format of it and what was on it, trust the 3 of us, not the other crackhead!!!

I have to say, he really isn't so bad. Yeah, the class is little hard, but it's not impossible. And the guy is pretty funny. It's not scary, just don't take the comments too seriously if they bug you that much.

He is the worst prof I have ever had. He is a narcisist who is obsessed with his "wonderful job". He answers his cell phone in class, swears constantly, yells at people 4 discussing info that he doesn't leave up long enuf. He also has a bunch of stab marks on his neck..this probably indicates that he was attacked by a client 4 being such a dick!
Worst prof I have ever had at this school! B-E-W-A-R-E do want to be yelled at and scared sh*tless? then take his class today!!!
